bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 16 June 1886
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Enclosed I send my piece in Thorndike Rice's just issued Lincoln Reminiscences—I don't know whether you will want it—but I do know you like to have earliest copies of any thing. Should you print it, I leave the head-lines & introductory to you—& dont forget to give Rice's book the due credit. Should you print, I wish you would send me here 25 copies paper.
—I am ab't as usual—just going to drive down 12 miles to visit a poor young fellow, Walter Borton, very low with consumption.
Love to Mrs. W. and the sister.

postscript.p: If you cant use it, return the enclosed proof to me.
